taxon_name.authority: B. L. Robinson in A. Gray et al.
(Nuttall ex Torrey & A. Gray) A. Gray

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family brassicaceae;tribe physarieae;genus physaria;species hemiphysaria;subspecies hemiphysaria

bio:treatment.description: Fruiting pedicels 4–6.5 mm. Fruits: valves pubescent, often sparsely so, trichomes uniform; style 3–5 mm.
Low ridges of sand and sandstone, bluish shaley clay outcrops, stony soil, open limey knolls, ridges;
bio:treatment.discussion: Subspecies hemiphysaria is found only in stony meadows of the Wasatch Plateau.
